author: Lewisboro Ledger
title: Harvey runners lose uphill battle
text:
By Lewisboro Ledger on October 15,   Harvey School cross country team captains Rohan Cassells, David Solano and Julia Mallon of Katonah. 
The Harvey School varsity cross country team saw some solid performances from its runners on Wednesday , but a predominantly uphill course proved to be too much to overcome to notch a team victory. 
South Kent School hosted Harvey, Watkinson, and Wooster in a four-school meet, with races involving two teams competing head-to-head. The Cavaliers lost to Wooster, 33-24, South Kent, 30-25, and Watkinson, 34-21. 
“It was a beautiful campus on a beautiful autumn day, but with hills comprising about 80% of the course, we found it to be a challenging race,” said Harvey Coach Mike Lauria. 
Finishing in first place was Clay Hoadley of South Kent at 21:06 . John Coleman of Watkinson was second with a time of 22:01 . 
Harvey’s top runner was senior captain Rohan Cassell, who finished in third place with a time of 22:28 . Senior Jovell Forsythe finished in 11 th place at 23:27 while sophomore Nathan Ward followed right behind in 12 th place with a time of 23:28 . Senior team captain David Solano finished strong with a time of 26:01. 
Although Harvey did not have enough girl runners to count for the race, captain Julia Mallon of Katonah, still testing the waters after an injury, ran a determined and impressive race with a time of 29:23. Related posts:
